name: Vishkambha
description: Vishkambha yoga represents support and stability but also obstacles. Activities requiring overcoming barriers are favored. Named after the pillar that supports, it suggests building strong foundations despite challenges.

name: Priti
description: Priti yoga is highly favorable for matters of love and affection. It promotes harmony in relationships and is excellent for marriage ceremonies, romantic proposals, and strengthening bonds with loved ones.

name: Ayushman
description: Ayushman yoga bestows longevity and good health. It is particularly favorable for medical treatments, health-related activities, and starting anything intended for long-term benefit. The Moon's influence promotes vitality.

name: Saubhagya
description: Saubhagya is one of the most fortunate yogas, bringing luck and prosperity. It is ideal for marriages, new ventures, and important beginnings. Activities started during this yoga are blessed with success.

name: Shobhana
description: Shobhana yoga enhances beauty, elegance, and artistic endeavors. It is excellent for activities related to aesthetics, fashion, art, and anything requiring creative expression or visual appeal.

name: Atiganda
description: Atiganda is considered highly inauspicious and dangerous. It is advisable to avoid starting new ventures, travel, or important activities. However, it can be used for protective and tantric rituals.

name: Sukarma
description: Sukarma yoga is excellent for performing good deeds and virtuous actions. It favors charitable activities, religious observances, educational pursuits, and any work done for the benefit of others.

name: Dhriti
description: Dhriti yoga promotes patience, stability, and steadfastness. It is ideal for activities requiring perseverance, long-term commitments, and meditation. Projects started now tend to have lasting success.

name: Shula
description: Shula yoga is named after the trident and relates to sharp, piercing activities. While generally inauspicious, it is favorable for surgeries, medical procedures involving cutting, and activities using sharp instruments.

name: Ganda
description: Ganda yoga signifies obstacles and potential dangers. It is advisable to avoid new ventures and important decisions. However, it supports fire-related rituals and activities to overcome existing obstacles.

name: Vriddhi
description: Vriddhi yoga promotes growth, expansion, and increase in all matters. It is excellent for business expansion, investments, agriculture, and any activity aimed at growth and prosperity.

name: Dhruva
description: Dhruva yoga represents permanence and stability, like the Pole Star. It is ideal for laying foundations, constructing permanent structures, making long-term commitments, and establishing anything meant to last.

name: Vyaghata
description: Vyaghata yoga indicates conflict and opposition. While not favorable for peaceful activities, it supports competitive endeavors, debates, sports, and situations requiring confrontation of opposition.

name: Harshana
description: Harshana yoga brings joy, happiness, and delight. It is perfect for celebrations, festivals, entertainment, and social gatherings. Activities performed bring happiness to all involved.

name: Vajra
description: Vajra yoga, named after Indra's thunderbolt, represents strength and indestructibility. It is favorable for activities requiring strength, working with precious stones, and establishing powerful foundations.

name: Siddhi
description: Siddhi yoga is extremely auspicious, promising success and accomplishment in all endeavors. It is one of the best yogas for starting important work, spiritual practices, and activities aimed at achievement.

name: Vyatipata
description: Vyatipata is considered one of the most inauspicious yogas, bringing calamity and misfortune. All auspicious activities should be avoided. However, it is suitable for ancestor worship and removing negative energies.

name: Variyana
description: Variyana yoga promotes comfort, luxury, and excellence. It is favorable for purchasing luxury items, comfort-related activities, and matters concerning wealth and material prosperity.

name: Parigha
description: Parigha yoga represents obstacles and barriers, like an iron bar blocking a gate. While it obstructs new beginnings, it is excellent for protective measures, security work, and strengthening defenses.

name: Shiva
description: Shiva yoga is one of the most auspicious, bringing divine blessings and auspiciousness. Named after Lord Shiva, it is excellent for spiritual practices, religious activities, meditation, and all positive endeavors.

name: Siddha
description: Siddha yoga ensures success and accomplishment. It is highly favorable for important decisions, starting new ventures, spiritual initiations, and completing important tasks. Success is almost guaranteed.

name: Sadhya
description: Sadhya yoga makes goals achievable and attainable. It is favorable for setting targets, working towards goals, completing pending tasks, and negotiations. Reasonable objectives can be accomplished.

name: Shubha
description: Shubha yoga is inherently auspicious, as its name suggests. It is favorable for all positive activities including marriages, religious ceremonies, new beginnings, and any work requiring divine blessings.

name: Shukla
description: Shukla yoga brings brightness, clarity, and purity. Ruled by Lakshmi, it is favorable for wealth matters, purchasing white-colored items, activities requiring clarity, and honest dealings.

name: Brahma
description: Brahma yoga, named after the Creator, is excellent for creative endeavors and new creations. It favors education, writing, artistic work, spiritual studies, and starting anything new and creative.

name: Indra
description: Indra yoga, named after the king of gods, is highly favorable for matters of authority and power. It supports government work, leadership roles, important meetings, and activities requiring prestige and power.

name: Vaidhriti
description: Vaidhriti is considered the most inauspicious yoga, representing division and obstacles. All positive activities should be avoided. It is only suitable for ancestor worship, remedial rituals, and obstacle removal.
